intro: Gyrostachys arrabidae, commonly known as the Portuguese heath, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing shrub form with evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in heathland and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
